column1: Boone ( BOON) is a city in Des Moines Township
column2: and county seat of Boone County
column3: Iowa
column4: United States. It is the principal city of the Boone
column6: which encompasses all of Boone County. This micropolitan statistical area
column8: Iowa Metropolitan Statistical Area comprise the larger Ames-Boone
column9: Iowa Combined Statistical Area. The population of the city was 12

column1: Coal mining played an important part in the early history of the Boone area. Local blacksmiths were already mining coal from the banks of Honey Creek south of what became Boone in 1849.
Boone was platted as a town in 1865 by John Insley Blair. It was incorporated the following year
column2: when the Chicago and North Western Transportation Company railroad station was built there. The town was originally named "Montana"; it was renamed to Boone in 1871. The nearby town of Boonesboro was also chartered in 1866; Boonesboro was annexed to Boone in 1887. The present name is a tribute to Nathan Boone
column3: son of explorer Daniel Boone.Commercial mining was spurred by the arrival of the railroad. In 1867
column4: Canfield and Taylor opened a mine just west of town.  Their mine shaft was 242 feet deep
column5: and they hauled coal to the railroad by wagon. In 1874
column6: a railroad spur was built to the mine.  This mine was taken over by the railroad

column1: There were coal seams in the Boone area; the upper vein
column2: about 3 feet thick
column3: was always worked using longwall mining
column4: while the lower vein was always mined using room and pillar mining. In 1912
column5: United Mine Workers Local 869 in Boone had 554 members
column6: close to 10% of the population at the time.The grocery chain Fareway originated in Boone. The company maintains their business offices in town also.The first Casey's General Store was founded in Boone
column7: Iowa in 1968.Other larger businesses that have had or still maintain facilities in Boone include Gates Rubber
column12: Quinn Iron & Wire Works (now Besser Quinn Machine & Foundry)

column1: Boone is located on U.S. Route 30. The original Lincoln Highway ran through the center of town
column2: but a new four-lane highway was built in the late 1960s that bypassed the center of Boone to the south. There is also a network of paved country roads radiating out in all directions.

column1: Boone is served by the mainline of the Union Pacific
column2: which purchased the Chicago & Northwestern Railroad (C&NW) in 1995. Boone was a division and crew change point on the railroad under the Chicago & Northwestern and some of that business remains today. There is a moderate-sized rail yard to the east of the downtown area. The locomotives no longer sound their horns in the town proper due to modifications to the various points where streets intersect with the rail line.

column1: Boone was also the exact midpoint on the Fort Dodge
column2: Des Moines & Southern Railroad
column3: an electric interurban line converted to diesel in 1955 after a flood on the Des Moines River devastated the Fraser hydroelectric power plant that supplied power to the railroad. It connected with the C&NW downtown. It was purchased by the C&NW in 1968 and subsequently abandoned. The western part of the line to Fraser has been resurrected as the Boone and Scenic Valley Railroad

column2: Milwaukee
column3: St. Paul and Pacific Railroad also ran a branch line into Boone from the southeast. It likewise connected with the C&NW. The line was trimmed back to Luther in the late 1960s and completely abandoned a few years later.

column1: The Boone Community School District operates local public schools.

column2: an annual event celebrating Boone's railroad heritage
column3: is held the week after Labor Day and is one of Iowa's top five community festivals with over 30
column4: 000 attendees.The IMCA Super Nationals are held at the Boone Speedway
column5: occurring during the week of labor day.Boone River Valley Festival was started in 2017 and takes place in May. It is an outdoor festival with events to celebrate all of the beauty and activities that Boone and Boone County have to offer.

column1: Boone is also a site of the annual Farm Progress Show. Originally the show rotated from one farm to another in Iowa
column2: Illinois and Indiana before the permanent sites were established at Boone
column3: Iowa and Decatur
column4: Illinois. The show now alternates between these two permanent sites on an annual basis.

column1: Vincenzo Miserendino's final and largest statue of Theodore Roosevelt
column2: which was eight times life-size was commissioned in 1941
column3: and was scheduled to arrive in Boone
column8: 000 pounds of bronze was appropriated for World War II.  Miserendino commented that Theodore Roosevelt himself would have approved of that decision to put the service of the country first.  Later
column10: the Roman Bronze Corporation of Corona
column12: produced the casting in Miserendino's original mold.  On January 6
column14: it was placed in McHose Park.  Residing on three large granite blocks
column15: the 6' 3" statue depicts Roosevelt rising out of a mountainous landscape with his hand outstretched as if addressing a crowd. Below the statue are ten bas reliefs of Roosevelt's outdoor accomplishments.Boone & Scenic Valley Railroad & James H. Andrew Railroad Museum is another point of interest. The B&SVRR allows you to view Boone and the Boone river valley area via train
column16: riding behind various historic train equipment. Thomas the Tank Engine makes annual visits to B&SVRR
column17: the Day Out with Thomas event
column18: usually in September. The railroad also hosts several "dinner" trains
column19: a regular weekly train excursion as well as a special Christmas themed event. The James H. Andrew museum
column21: highlights railroad history with a variety of exhibits and actual railroad related artifacts.
